title: Sitting Tai Chi exercise improves recovery outcomes for older stroke survivors: Study
description: A new study has found that stroke survivors who practised a seated form of Tai Chi had equal or greater improvement in hand and arm strength, shoulder range of motion, balance control, symptoms of depression and activities of daily living after three months, compared to those who participated in a standard stroke rehabilitation exercise program.

title: Study details how exercise reduces depression
description: Regular exercise is a wonderful tool for overcoming depression .According to a new study led by researchers at the Iowa State University, exercising for half an hour may reduce symptoms of depression for at least 75 minutes post-workout and amplify the benefits of therapy.
